intro.title: Identify Your Interpersonal Goals
intro.description: Before any interpersonal interaction, it's important to clarify what you want to achieve. Identify your objectives, relationship, and self-respect goals, then rank them by importance for your current situation.

sections.title: Objective Effectiveness
sections.placeholder: What outcome do you want? What specific result or outcome are you hoping to achieve from this interaction?

sections.title: Relationship Effectiveness
sections.placeholder: What do you want for the relationship from this interaction? How do you want this interaction to affect your relationship with the other person?

sections.title: Self-Respect
sections.placeholder: How do you want to feel about yourself afterward? What do you need to do or say to feel good about yourself and maintain your self-respect?

sections.title: Relationship Mindfulness
sections.placeholder: What do you want to stay aware of about the relationship as you talk? What aspects of your relationship do you want to keep in mind during this conversation?

subsections.title: Most Important Goal
subsections.placeholder: Which goal is most important to you in this situation? Explain why this goal matters most to you right now.

subsections.title: Second Most Important Goal
subsections.placeholder: Which goal is your second priority? Explain why this goal is your second priority.

subsections.title: Least Important Goal
subsections.placeholder: Which goal is least important in this situation? Why is this goal less of a priority for you right now?

subsections.title: Why These Priorities?
subsections.placeholder: What factors influenced your ranking? What circumstances, values, or needs led you to prioritize these goals in this way?

subsections.title: How Will You Communicate?
subsections.placeholder: Based on your priorities, how will you approach this conversation? Given your most important goal, what approach, tone, or strategy will help you achieve it?
